node.text:
LEAF PAINTING 🍁🍂🍃🌿- I’m reposting this fun LIVE I did with @mastermindtoys on Friday because there are so many fun leaf painting techniques! And I love that you can use so many different kinds of paint and supplies to make beautiful art 🤩 Sorry the sound is a little off 🙈 the Lives can do that. Let me know in the comments below if you guys would like to see more craft and art tutorial lives! ❤️
.
.
Here’s what you need:
-Leaves 🍂🍁🌿
-Paint - we used watercolors, acrylic and puffy paint (special thanks to @colormadehappy for the puffy paint idea)
-White cardstock 
.
.
For the full post head to thebestideasforkids.com and search “Leaf Painting” or head to: https://www.thebestideasforkids.com/leaf-painting/
.
.
Follow us at @bestideasforkids for more fun kids crafts and activities 🌈 🎨 
.
.
For the giveaway by @mastermindtoys this is open to Canadian residents 18+. This giveaway is not affiliated or endorsed by Instagram. 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

FULL RECIPE: https://www.thebestideasforkids.com/butter-slime/

FROG FOLDING SURPRISE 🐸 
Looking for a simple activity that doesn’t require any prep?! 🙌

This surprise frog craft 🐸 is not only easy to make - but kids love to play with the opening and closing of the surprise! 

It’s easy to fold- just fold the paper down, then fold the top piece up. Now the mouth goes from closed to open! 

DM me if you want the free template - or head to thebestideasforkids.com and get it on the post. 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and activity ideas. 🖍✂️

node.text:
ICE CHALK 🌈 - a fun summer activity perfect for all those bits and pieces of leftover chalk 👌 and if you’re asking.. why? 😱 This is a great sensory activity for kids. It’s something new to try outside and the kids can even help you make them. You can make larger batches by freezing in small lunch containers like salad dressing containers or using a bigger ice cube mold. 

Here’s how to make it ✨

Grate or use a rolling pin to smash up half of a piece of sidewalk chalk.

Add 2 tablespoons of cornstarch into the measuring cup.

Add 4 tablespoons of water. 

Mix with a whisk.
Pour the mixture into an ice cube tray or small plastic container.

Repeat for each color you'd like to make. Double or triple the recipe to make a larger batch. This recipe will fill 2-3 ice cubes.

Add mini popsicle sticks into the ice cube trays. You can lean them to one side to keep them standing up.

Freeze.
Once frozen, let the ice cube tray sit out for a few minutes so that you can easily pull the paintsicles out.

Have fun 🤩 🥳🌈

.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️

node.text:
MOON SAND 🏖 (taste safe 👅)
We’ve seen moon sand made a few times and typically it calls for 8 cups of flour to 1 cup of oil. Since flour is raw before being cooked, it’s not taste safe for kids. So the first time we saw taste safe sand was by our friend @mothercould be sure to check it out as she has a different method 🤩
.
I wanted to see if I could make a taste safe sand with cornstarch 👌 and made this amazing sand that looks 👀 like sand and smells 👃 like the beach 🏖 🥥 My kids even said they prefer it to regular sand! 🙌 

Note- while taste safe, we don’t recommend you allow kids actually eat it so as always, supervise during play. 

Here’s what you need:
- 1 cup of cornstarch 
- 1 cup of light brown sugar
- 4 tablespoons of coconut oil 🥥 (melted before adding). 

Note: To make this taste safe, bake the cornstarch in advance in the oven. Place the cornstarch on a baking tray and spread it out. Bake at 300 degrees Fahrenheit for 10 minutes. Allow to cool before making the recipe.

Make sure to whisk and mix together until all of the clumps are gone. 
.
Follow us at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and recipe ideas. 🖍✂️
.
Save this post for later by clicking the flag 🏳️at the bottom of the post ❤️
.
Get the full details by searching “Taste Safe Moon Sand” on thebestideasforkids.com
.
.
.
.
.
.
. .
.

node.text:
RAINBOW BUBBLE WRAP PRINTING 🌈🤩
Such a simple art activity! Grab some leftover paper rolls and bubble wrap and make some recycled ♻️ art 😍

Glue the bubble wrap to the paper roll. Then paint the colors you want around the bubble wrap. Then roll! Keep adding more paint if you want to do it again. Make some fun wrapping paper this way ✨ 

This craft is from my book - Fun & Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 📚 It has 60 recycled crafts for kids in it. 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and activity ideas. 🖍✂️
.

.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
LETTER MATCH SENSORY BAG 🔠
Here’s a fun way to practice lowercase and uppercase letters 🤩 If you’re just working on lowercase or uppercase only you can do a matching activity with just the one too. 💛💚💙❤️
.
Here’s what you need:
-Sealed top bag (we used Large Ziploc bags)
-Permanent Markers
-Clear Hair Gel
-Letter Magnets 
.
Use a circle shape like a cup to draw your circles. Add letters inside for matching. We did lowercase and uppercase letters. Add in hair gel. You want enough so the letters are easy to move around. Then add in your letters and seal the bag. For extra protection you can add some duct tape to the top.
You can use alphabet beads and use smaller circles too! 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kids crafts and activities 🌈 🎨 .
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
COLOR CHANGING SLIME 🤩
This may be the coolest slime we’ve ever made 😮. I’ll share in stories how this turned out for us too but we had so much fun testing both types of color changing slime!

We made both heat activated and sun activated slime: 
Yellow 💛 to Red ❤️
Pink 💖to Purple 💜
Blue 💙 to Purple 💜
Light Green 💚 to Dark Green 💚

We tested out Elmers heat activated and sun activated color changing slime. Both were so much fun! Add some ice 🧊 to change the color of the heat activated slime. Take the sun activated slime out in the sun ☀️ and it instantly changes. 🤩

Here’s what you need: 
5 oz. of Elmer's Color Changing Glue (if you get a larger bottle just adjust the ratio of the other ingredients) 

1/2 tsp Baking Soda

1/4 cup Water

1 1/2 tbsp Contact Lens Solution

*Important: your brand of contact lens solution must have boric acid and sodium borate in the ingredient list. This is what interacts with the glue to form the slime.

Instructions
- Add your glue to a bowl. 
- Add you water 💦 and baking soda and then mix. 
- Now slowly add in your contact solution.  
- I like to add in 1 tablespoon, knead for 5 minutes and then add in the 1/2 tablespoon after kneading for some time. The slime will be very sticky when you're kneading - and that's normal! 
- If you find it still too sticky after kneading - add some baby oil or lotion to your hands.

Note- making slime is still a science experiment, adult supervision required. Please read the full post on our website before making it.

Save this post for later by clicking the flag 🏳️at the bottom of the post ❤️

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️

node.text:
GROW A RAINBOW 🤩🌈 
sharing this one again because it’s always such a hit with the kids 🙌🌈
When I created this fun new twist on some other classic science experiments back in the spring of last year I had no idea how viral it would go. 🤯 I’ve seen so many people try it and that is so so cool! 😎
Have you had a chance to try it yet? Tag someone who you think might like to!

Here are some tips to get it to work:
- You need washable markers, we used Crayola. Make sure to add a good amount of ink on both sides.
- Absorbent paper towel, we used Bounty (napkin works too)
- Don’t place the ends too deep into the water
- The closer the jars are together the better
.
For the full details, supply list and more tips head to: https://www.thebestideasforkids.com/grow-a-rainbow-experiment/ or search “Grow a Rainbow” on thebestideasforkids.com

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid crafts and activity ideas. 🖍✂️
.

.

.

FROZEN FLOWERS 🌸 🌼🌻
This is a simple and pretty sensory activity for kids. They are so pretty when frozen and after you are done you can make fairy soup 🤩 Just add a few drops of pink or purple food coloring to a water table.💦 

Here’s what you need:
-Flowers 🌸🌼🌻
-Muffin Pan 
-Water 💦 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and activity ideas. 🖍✂️

node.text:
THE BEST FLUFFY SLIME 💜💙💖

Slime may be messy, but when your kids play with it for an hour straight and you can get dinner made, trust me it’s 💯 worth it 😆 Keep some vinegar on hand (it gets it out of anything) and let’s make the BEST fluffy slime!

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and recipe ideas. 🖍✂️

Here’s what you need:
- 2/3 Cup White Elmer's Glue (any white glue works but I’ve tested many any Elmers is the best!)
- 1/2 teaspoon Baking Soda
- 1/4 Cup Water
- 2-3 Cups Shaving Cream
- 1.5 tablespoons Contact Lens Solution **Important: your brand of contact lens solution must have boric acid and sodium borate in the ingredient list. This is what interacts with the glue to form the slime.
- Food Coloring

Instructions
- Add your white glue to a bowl. 
- Add you water 💦 and baking soda and then mix. 
- Add your shaving cream and mix. The more shaving cream you add, the fluffier it will be. You may need to add more contact lens solution if you make it with 3 cups.  
- Add your food coloring until you are satisfied with the color. Mix. 
- Now slowly add in your contact solution.  
- I like to add in 1 tablespoon, knead for 5 minutes and then add in the 1/2 tablespoon after kneading for some time. The slime will be very sticky when you're kneading - and that's normal! It’s going to stick to your hands during this process. Add some baby oil or lotion to your hands when you’re kneading. 

Note- making slime is still a science experiment, adult supervision required. Please read the full post on our website before making it.

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and recipe ideas. 🖍✂️

.
.
.
.

node.text:
FIZZY DINOSAUR EGGS 🦕 🦖🥚
Got a dino fan? 🦖 
These fizzy dinosaur eggs are always a hit!

Mix 1/2 cup of baking soda with 2 tablespoons of colored water. To make a larger batch for more eggs, double or triple the recipe. Freeze for 15 minutes. Then use vinegar with some droppers to “hatch” the eggs.

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and activity ideas. 🖍✂️
.
.
Get the full details by search “Fizzy Dinosaur Eggs” on thebestideasforkids.com or head to: https://www.thebestideasforkids.com/fizzy-dinosaur-eggs/

node.text:
☁️CLOUD DOUGH ☁️- Here is my favorite, no cook dough recipe made with only 2 main ingredients. 🙌
This dough is super soft to touch and easy to make 🤩

Follow me @bestideasforkids for more fun ideas for kids 🌈

Here’s what you need:
1/2 cup of lotion 🧴
1 cup of cornstarch (also called cornflour)
Mix it together and knead until you get a dough-like consistency. If it’s too dry, add more lotion, if it’s too sticky add a little more cornstarch. Store with Saran Wrap and in a ziploc bag. If it dries out just add a few more squirts of lotion and knead in.

For the full details and supply list head to:
https://www.thebestideasforkids.com/cloud-dough/

Follow me @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️

.

node.text:
POOL NOODLE BOATS ⛵️ 
Cool off this summer with this fun pool noodle craft! Kids will need some help with cutting up the noodles, but then they can decorate their boats with some foam sheets, a straw and washi tape! 
Add to a water bin, table or bring in the pool 💦 
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and activity ideas. 🖍✂️
